DOC.brief_summary: This study was designed to look at effects of salmeterol/fluticasone propionate compared to placebo on airway inflammation in patients with chronic obstructive airways disease
DOC.brief_title: Airway Inflammation In Patients With Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease
DOC.criteria: Established clinical history of chronic obstructive airways disease. Must be current or exsmokers with a smoking history of at least 10 packyears (e.g. 20 cigarettes/day for 10 years or 10 cigarettes/day for 20 years). Must have reduced lung function, defined as a Forced Expiratory Volume in 1 second (FEV1) of between 4080% of predicted normal values. Diagnosis of any other serious disease and must have a chest Xray to eliminate a diagnosis other than COPD.
